title: Paper planes, stink bombs and fire-starting: The Dangerous Book for Boys has a sequel, and it's less PC than ever
text:
A decade after his hit manual for boys aged eight to 80, Conn Iggulden explains why he’s written an equally un-PC sequel – and shares some of its best bits

Conn Iggulden, author of the ferociously successful The Dangerous Book For Boys, has written a sequel, but has not included the most dangerous thing he has ever done.

“We were writing about knots and naturally I wanted to include the hangman’s noose,” he says, sitting at the broad kitchen table of his house in Hertfordshire. “But the problem is that once you’ve made a noose you just have to try it on. When I did, I pulled the wrong end and tightened it. And my brother, trying to help, did the same.” Even though it wasn’t attached to anything,...
